summary: This is an email chain among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing the logistics of picking up a signed 6(e) order from Judge Alison Nathan's chambers. The order pertains to the Epstein case, indicating ongoing grand jury secrecy or procedural matters.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge who signed the Epstein 6(e) order and whose chambers the order is ready to be picked up from.

events.title: Epstein 6(e) Order Signed
events.description: Judge Alison Nathan signs a 6(e) order related to the Epstein case, and her clerk notifies the U.S. Attorney's Office that it is ready for pickup.

keyFacts: A 6(e) order (related to grand jury secrecy) in the Epstein case was signed by Judge Alison Nathan.
The order was ready for pickup from Judge Nathan's chambers on January 31, 2020.
The email chain shows coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding procedural steps in the Epstein case.
The document indicates ongoing legal proceedings or grand jury matters in the Epstein case as of early 2020.
The correspondence reflects standard inter-office logistics for handling sensitive court orders.
